str2: From the same as alektor and aner; man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A worker in brass or copper; a smith. From chalkos; a copper-worker or brazier.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
